Perhaps I had an advantage in not viewing the 2003 picture and therefore no chance to compare it unfavorably.The film is science fiction/fantasy and there is no need to have seen the original as this story stands on its' own so to speak.In any event this movie is quite good and centers on a group of 4 friends and what happens when one of them can change the past and hence the future. It is also a story about love and loss and sacrifice. In my opinion all the actors give interesting and convincing performances.I thought the various scenario's where the past was changed were well done and the ultimate conclusion in the play satisfactory.6/10.

reviews.review_title: Bit of an insult to the first butterfly effect
reviews.content: This film didn't have the depth that the first one had. I felt the lead character was shallow and cheesy. This ones all about work promotion and trying to get his girlfriend back. The short runtime didn't allow for any decent development. Sorry to negative

To be treated rather separately from its Ashton Kutcher-starring predecessor of 2 years earlier, John Leonetti's "Butterfly Effect 2" differs from "1" in dispensing with the extremely dark and drastic storylines that more or less compelled Kutcher playing Evan Treborn to make use of his inherited powers to revisit and reshape his past.This time it is Eric Lively's "Nick" who has basically the same power, but in this shortish film he gets to use it surprisingly few times, though we again are clear that it "takes a lot out of him" each time he does. Given that one (or actually more) of these reworkings inevitably revolves around saving the life of a loved one, the stakes are still pretty high (and the hero's joy at his success in "bringing Julie back" IS done touchingly well); but it's not like in "1", and in some ways that's actually a relief. At least one of the returns to the past via a photo also relates to less life-and-death matters, being rather a matter of career success, and here we have further moments of interest, as it becomes clear what is lost just as financial status is on a higher plane in this particular version of Nick's life. It's not extremely compelling but is a little thought-provoking. Frankly, the film also seeks to outdo its predecessor in being more sexy and risky in various ways, at various moments; but really it seems to do that a little out of desperation. Seeing Lindsay Maxwell as the boss's daughter hungry enough for Nick is not unalluring, though needless shoving in elsewhere of a plot strand involving drugs seems crass.Most surprisingly, "BE2" cuts to the chase by having its hero - unreasonably obsessed as he is with one or two points in his past (given the presumable possibility of choosing many others to revisit) - deciding to make a sacrifice for Erica Durance as love of his life Julie. It goes wrong anyway, but even had it not there seems no obvious reason why he should choose to go so far on the basis of some kind of moment of self-loathing. Surely he would have been more content to rejig the situation again, perhaps even at some quite separate point in history, allowing the timeline to go its own sweet way and never again entail the dangerous moment that is made to seem so central to this film?It is such lack of obvious cohesion that contrasts this film with its predecessor, though it can reasonably be argued that "1" did take a hammer to crack a nut, as it were. There is no danger of that with "2", but there is also not much danger of this movie being a "life-changing experience" for those who watch it either.

I came to this movie since I simply loved the first one, however after seeing these comments I was expecting the worse. I have to say I got more than I've expected.The movie comprises Eric Lively(Nick) as it's main character; a sales agent for a new startup. He is accompanied with the lovely Erica Durance(Julie) who is a photography artist wishing to create her own gallery some day. Nick reaches certain turning points in his life and exploits a certain schizophrenia disease he suffers from to create different realities. The filmography and acting is decent as well as a rather good storyline. I must warn you however that it is acutely similar to the first. The ideas and concepts are identical. The storyline has several differences including the ending but overall there will be many parts which will almost duplicate with the first.Ultimately, if you haven't seen "The Butterfly Effect" I strongly recommend you see this sequel, since it is merely a different version of the first. If you have seen it you probably won't enjoy it as much but it will pass a few hours by pleasantly.** 6/10

This is not really a sequel to the good, fascinating original, this is just a Canadian made watered down rehash version.Film could never hope to capture the mood,the emotion and the impact of the original film.That said, this has it's moments and isn't in my opinion a complete loss,it's just that you know what's coming.Capably performed on a noticeably low budget,unlike the original film the ending here does not pack an emotional wallop.Watchable but it wasn't really in the same class. A fascinating context to cover in these films,but a note to the producers,i am not sure how well this film did at the box office, and if there are any plans for any more sequels.Leave it at this, no more please.

reviews.review_title: 'The Butterfly Effect 2' gets the high-definition treatment
reviews.content: You can bank on it that if a film is a mild success in theaters, studios will find a way to exploit the situation and make more money off the concept. The best example of this is the thousands of direct-to-DVD sequels that litter the walls of movie rental stores across the country. Most are pale reflections of the originals. Every once in a while a sequel comes along that doesn't improve on the first one, but still manages to entertain. "The Butterfly Effect 2" falls into this category. It's both entertaining and thought-provoking at the same time. I saw "The Butterfly Effect" when it hit DVD a few years ago and liked it. I never got around to seeing the sequel but remained mildly interested in checking it out because it starred Erica Durance from "Smallville." I'm glad I had the opportunity to see it.Nick, his girlfriend Julie, and their two best friends are struck by a semi on the way home from vacation. Everyone is killed but Nick, leaving him alone to deal with the aftermath of the tragedy. He discovers he has the power to travel to the past and change events in his life. Nick starts to alter reality and finds that each jump back in time isn't necessarily changing things for the better in the present or the future. You can tell director John R. Leonetti put his blood, sweat, and tears into this movie but was limited as to what he could do because of the budget. It doesn't feel like a straight-to-DVD movie besides some of the camera-work. The wreck looks realistic and most of the time-warp scenes look decent. The special effects aren't perfect by any means but get the job done. One issue with the film is that there are points where it reminds me of a late-night Cinemax skin flick. There are some soft-core porn sequences that feel placed in the film to attract that audience base. I feel it cheapens the movie and takes the focus off of a relatively decent storyline. "The Butterfly Effect 2" stands on its own and doesn't require anyone who didn't see the first film from grasping what's happening. It's strictly for people who enjoyed "The Butterfly Effect" and couldn't get enough or those who never saw it and just happen upon this one first.

Way to easy to see everything that is going to happen. No real suspense no unseen twist. This is bad even for a sequel. The movie also had a lot of not needed sexual scenes. Scenes that could have been without being as intense as they were. Not a movie at all for kids. The moving left you waiting for nothing except for it to end. There were no real flashbacks like in the original when he was a kid. The concept of the movie was great, the way they told it was poor. The complete movie was boring. They started off with some drama which is the exact spot they keep going back to. They could have done a lot more with the movie. A little more background a little more on consequences, or the risk reward, "butterfly affect" they really didn't do much with that.

"The Butterfly Effect" is one of my favorite movies of all time. I've seen it numerous times without it ever losing its original effect. It's such a strong, powerful movie that stands tall on its own.But of course, they had to milk some money out of the thing, didn't they? "The Butterfly Effect 2", which I cringe every time I write, is the sequel to the original movie (but in my brain - a.k.a. my perfect place - it doesn't even exist. such a great place, my brain!) but in reality feels more like a lame horrid "remake". I say "remake" because, even if the characters and situations are different, apart from that the overall plot is just a washed out (very washed out, mind you) version of the original title.There's nothing original here, no depth, the characters aren't even likable, why should I care for the main guy, when he seems to be using his "butterfly effect" just because he feels bored? Plus, each and every decision he makes in the whole movie is questionable at best. No one in his right mind would ever do anything he did during the entire movie, it's just ridiculously bad writing.And the ending? I don't even want to talk about the ending... it was bad enough having to watch it trying to maintain a straight face and fighting my impulses to turn the movie off.Music department, didn't even come to mind - that's how mediocre it was. Visual effects are terrible as well, the title screen made me want to stab my eye with a shard of glass for how bad it looks (seriously that "2" showing up is so cheesy, badly edited and out of place). Cinematography and photography were OK, I guess. Nothing too fancy, nothing too horrible or out of place, it was just OK.I really wanted to like this sequel, I really did, out of my love for the first movie (and Erica Durance! :D) but I couldn't. At all.Awkward moments. Horrid character development. Questionable character decisions. Washed away / non existent plot. Just terrible.Stay away from this movie, seriously.Now, will I have the guts to watch the third part?2 out of 10.

Poorly executed story and effects results in a tediously plodding film that goes nowhere. Tries to throw in short gratuitous secks scenes, limited urban and natural cinematography, but only succeeds in making the lead character look as idiotic as he apparently is. Don't let the title fool you (as if this nonsense is anything like the original). What a waste of time.

Basically, this is one of the worst sequels i have ever seen. It has the exact same elements as the first one and very similar scenerios. The actors are terrible, with the exception of Erica Durance, and it wasn't nearly as interesting as the first one. The movie is about a man who can go into the past to change or alter and even that took place. The same thing happens in the first one. Instead of using a journal he uses pictures much like Evan's father did. However, the movie doesn't explain the main characters past and leaves the audience wondering when he developed this ability. You do not get to know the character as well as you did in the first one and its harder to get into the movie because of this.

310. The Butterfly Effect 2. Sure I'm well over a decade behind on catching up on the Butterfly Effect trilogy, and whew, it's a good thing I did, so I won't have to waste time on watching part 3. So there's two couples out on vacation, everything is just swell, ooops, popped a tire, car goes out of control, gets hit by a semi and everybody bites the big one except the driver named Nick. He wakes up from the accident in the hospital finds out everyone's fate, but Nick still has to go to work, and just when it can't get any worse...it can tho, cause I'm leaving out the really really boring backstory... Nick discovers pics from the day of the accident, and he also discovers a new power, if he feels really really bad about something and stares at a picture, he can jump into himself at the time of the picture, wow!! So as you can imagine, he goes back, saves everyone from dying, however, with each little stitch across time, Nick becomes a bigger jerk. And in the end, once he realizes he's a total moron, he goes back to the beginning to fix it all over again, by cutting ties. He dumps his girlfriend, finds out shes pregnant, she gets in the car that's about to crash, Nick somehow diverts that from happening, then kinda casually drives off a cliff, killing himself, leaving his pregnant girlfriend behind and a child without a father. It just makes sense, thats why? And another thing, there is two very long love scenes in this gem, without nudity, which for some reason made it feel very uncomfortable. Michael Kelso couldn't save this crapfest! Filmbufftim on FB.

reviews.review_title: no no no ... what is this, some kind of a joke ?!
reviews.content: First of all, let me put down some parts I did like: most of all, the effect in which the movie name appears (especially the '2' from Butterfly Effect 2) won some points for this movie. I somewhat liked the characters and though some (sadly) unexploited relationships (Nick - Bristol, for example)BUT! I'm kind of having the feeling I have only seen just a part of the movie! Every twist Nick caused in his reality ... wasn't well argued... we didn't see some explanation, some feeling of his character adapting to that reality... Secondly... I definitely think that he gave up too easily. Remember the first part... how Kutcher tries every possibility before he gives up ? Well, this time he tried 2 or 3 ways and that's it... Not to mention that every time he goes in some parallel reality, the story lasts too much... without necessarily adding something really important to the story. The plot is too superficial this time. Now, that we've accustomed to those time-twists, we have nothing to get stunned from. And with that, there goes the pleasure of seeing a movie!How about the orange-colored (and not dark-reddish) blood Nick wipes out of his face every time? Or why didn't they try harder on the effect of 'transportation' ? It's simply some minor twist/blur to the setting and that it.. poof, we're somewhere else!What the ****? I started moving in my chair 15 minutes before the movie was over, I could barely resist not closing it. It's like the whole movie is a set for a great ending that doesn't appear. Anyway, the ending I personally find ridiculous. The whole movie we see him going back in time, and that is HIS time, but the rest's too. What is wrong with the last time ? WHY did the director / editor feel it would be such a great idea to end the movie as him being his lover's baby?! Or, accepting this, why there is no emotional burst in the end, to make us feel that he had really sacrificed himself for the others, as he claims he would ?To summarize, I'd say that this movie accomplishes in some way to impress his viewers, in the way that you will probably get flabbergasted when rewinding it for analysis. The actors play quite well, I guess it's not their fault the story is mediocre... Indeed, this movie is mediocre, gave it 6/10 given the basic idea... and the beginning. But it's quite much. Perhaps got me in a great mood for that mark

reviews.review_title: WHY do "they" make crappy sequels ? Why oh why ??
reviews.content:
Here we go again, with a "sequel" that has so little in comon with the original that it should hang its head in shame ! Have a quick look at all the 1. 2, and 3 ratings. Of course, following a pattern I've noted time after time on IMdB, there are some 10s and 9s for a big flop of a film. Who are most (not all, let me add) of the "reviewers" who do this ?? Cast or crew members/friends? Kids? A little research shows that usually most "reviewers" doing this have reviewed only one, two or maybe five movies. The following 10/10 "review" for The Butterfly Effect 2 is from an IMdB member who has reviewed a grand total of two flicks! Here's the header: 
" 10/10 Better than I thought it would be imafan41118 October 2006 " 
There's precious little to recommend this motion picture... the music is dreary, the acting amateurish, plot (what plot?), cinematography fair at best, pacing dull, uneven, script duh!, effects meh!... you get the idea. 
The movie seems to have been put together by a bunch of smartypants juveniles who figure THEY know what's happening. Nope, they don't ! This is one to miss ~ at any time, in any time zone, in any universe. I rate it 2/10 because there are films that are worse. 
#

This really is a pointless sequel - I'm all for a sequel to BE but this is not it - they knew that when they made this, no matter how bad it was it would still turn a profit because of the name. A lot of studios do this - they shamelessly turn out a poor sequel direct to video knowing it will still make a profit - I'm not against them making money - just not when its at the expense of their viewing customers. A shameful effort at film-making. Avoid at all costs. I wasn't expecting a film of the same calibre as the first but this was about as bad as a film gets - tedious, boring and doesn't follow any of the aspects of the first - there seems no point in him bringing his dull friends back to life as he is out for himself and what good is that from a main character - he has no likable traits and also there is no explanation behind why he can go back in time and when he does - even for the first time he doesn't seem surprised at what he just did - he just looks around for 2 seconds and then kind of goes like oh OK I've gone back in time.... absolute rubbish.

reviews.review_title: Same concept as the first one, but different story. Also pace was slower, but still interesting overall. Again not for young ages.
reviews.content: Fiction film/drama. The idea is a sequel to the first film, although the "disease" is a little different. In other words, one can go back to one's younger self when concentrating on a memory, a photo in this case or a video or calendar as in the first film, only this time the patient's younger self has no memory gaps. As in the first, the slightest change in the past changes the future, as the butterfly effect. In the end, as in the first one, although at some point he has it all, at least the important things in life, he wants to fix more and ultimately destroys the important... Generally interesting story, perhaps I would like more suspense as in the first, as here it reduced pace. Overall it is recommended for once if you liked the first.

I was very disappointed with the Butterfly Effect 2. An American friend of mine had told me that it had come out in the States but went straight to DVD because it performed poorly. I wanted to see why this was the case, and did not believe that it would be so awful (probably because the Butterfly Effect is my all time favorite movie). But I must admit it was horrible. The acting was not good, the plot was a bore, and there were no elements of surprise as there were in the first one. I would not recommend this movie to anyone who had particularly enjoyed the first one. It is a waste of time and effort trying to watch this film.

reviews.review_title: Basically, the first movie without it's charm.
reviews.content: I adore the original movie! It has a wonderful story, that is also deep and even thought provoking. It maybe dark and thrilling, but it's a still a movie worth watching. Because it was successful with young adult audience, New line cinema decided to create a sequel to it's hit. And since they already proved they can do sequels well with Final destination 2, doing one for Butterfly effect wouldn't be a big of a deal. Unfortunately, this is something that most fans wished would happen. Since it's not one of those cases.Sadly, the plot is a rehash of the first movie, it also features the new main character, in that case Nick Larson (Eric Lively), saving his girlfriend Julie (Erica Durance) from a car crash. And later he tries to fix his timeline again several times, including his attempt to try to get a better position at work. What's upsetting, is that, despite being a rehash of the first movie, it doesn't have the same charm as before. The characters have no backstory outside of the birthday in the nature scene, thus making the movie shallow. Not to mention, there's no good explanation on why Nick has the powers to time travel. Not to mention, that the office environment is very boring and unfitting for a sci-fi kind of film. And how the protagonist tries to use his powers just to get a promotion.But that's only the tip of the iceberg. It also has underdeveloped characters. Nick is just a terrible protagonist. Because he's very egotistical, and mostly cares about his career instead of friends and family. Sure, in the beginning it feels like he cares about Julie, but as the plot moves on, it feels less and less genuine. He does some stupid mistakes, which I won't spoil, but his actions were inexcusable! Unlike Evan in the original, who truly tried to help his friends and fix mistakes for a good reason. Other characters were just generic. Julie is the love interest who is also a photographer, Amanda and Trevor are just friends who aren't memorable at all, and Dave Bristol the boss, who wants his company to succeed. None of the characters are good. Maybe the best character is Nick's mom, who is the only one who cares about her son's mental health after the car crash accident. At least she felt like Andrea Treborn in the 2004 movie.Lastly, this movie had terrible camera work and weird soundtrack. For example, it would zoom into Nick's face during the car crash scene, instead of focusing on different angles. Sure, I never filmed a movie in my life, but still, it's very noticeable, it sticks out like a sore thumb. As for the soundtrack, it's the same as before, except, it's placed in random scenes, that just don't get along. For Example, after Julie is saved from the accident, she and Nick decided to, say in an appropriate way, make out and kiss in the bed. They played Kayleigh's funeral song, which is obviously a very sad one, that definitely doesn't fit the scene. Again, I'm not a director, but even I can point it out.Overall, I feel like in the right hands, Butterfly effect could have been the next Final destination for New line cinema, since the original was great. However, I feel like the movie, both with it's writing and technical stand point, was done by amateurs. It had none of the original's charm or creativity while making this. They didn't even mention diaries, black outs, emotional traumas or anything like that even once. My best recommendation is to skip this sequel at all cost, no matter if you seen the first movie or not. In fact, I'd rather advise you to either watch other time travelling films like Back to the future or Groundhog day, another Ashton Kutcher movie like What happens in Vegas or Open season (despite the movies being comedies) or even trying to write one yourself. No matter what you choose, any of the options is better than wasting time on this cheap sequel. I really got bored when watching this film, and I feel terrible that the franchise went this bad route.

As a big fan of "Butterfly Effect" I was very disappointed at this one. I don't even think they should have called it "Butterfly Effect". The plot was awful, and the acting wasn't that great. It also had way to much sex it in for me. I'm not against sex, but this movie had just too much compared to the first one which had one scene but not as "detailed" as the second. The first one had you at the end of your seat wondering what was going on, this one I was yawning and on the computer I was not interested. I really didn't feel the love between the two main people, as I did in Butterly Effect. Trust me, do not watch this one it's not worth the 3.50 I paid to rent it.

I love the first film. It introduced an interesting concept and an interwoven storyline. It will remain in my archive indefinitely.As for this one, well, some force on the planet must put an end to the cheap follow up films, trying to take advantage of the success of their predecessors. I mean, one simply does not have the right to ruin our expectations and warp the Butterfly Effect title in our minds just for some quick cash.A relatively short film with universally awful scenario, casting, special effects, audio and acting. I am an optimistic person, I expected an even greater scenario with a really shocking ending, great acting, lots of variety in locations and people. At the very start I was a bit worried but it didn't remain like that, it turned into disappointment. And my expectations faded with every passing moment, vanishing in the final scene.My only wish for Butterfly Effect 2 is that, it should suffer heavy failure in terms of box office, so it would be an example for all potential let downs. We don't want another ruined title.There is nothing interesting in this film, except for those who crave for some standard erotic scenes. Go watch some rush hour traffic, or do nothing at all. Everything is better than watching this movie.

I cannot believe how INCREDIBLY bad this movie is. Why even bother making a sequel if there's no point, no story, no message, no acting skills, no reason ....NO REASON. It's a greed issue, and with greed, the story ALWAYS changes. He has no recollection of what happened in the past, no reason to change the future, no reason relationship with him and his girlfriend and friends....there's nothing to tell. Sadly, this is how America works. Again, a GREED issue.But then again, that's what sequels are for, right? To make money, straight to DVD. Guess what, it just might be worth the download, but I seriously want my 2 hours back.

reviews.review_title: Wait for HBO to show it
reviews.content: Not sure if this will contain a spoiler or not, but, just in case. I gave this movie a 6 only because of the premise of the story, being able to go back to ones own past and change it. thats where it ends. the movie was a shallow sequel (if one wants to call it a sequel)It really had nothing to do with the first movie, different characters, different story line, etc. The special FX were cool, the acting...on a scale of 1-10, give the actors a 7. Not horrible, not great and I thought Ashton wasn't any good until I saw Bitterfly Effect 1! These actors seem to be right out of acting school! Shallow, unconvincing, almost expressionless. I, like another reviewer wondered why this film never saw the theater, I now know. For your money, rent a different film and wait for this to show on cable.

Before i watched this movie,i never knew it even existed,now i know why. Comparing this movie to the first one is like comparing an expensive sports car to an egg(a rotten one at that).The acting is quite poor and the film feels totally rushed,but my main problem with this movie is that it seems pointless(*spoiler alert*),when the guy 'jumps'into the alternative reality the first time everything is actually fine,apart from the fact he quits his job,so actually he could of stuck with it and helped his girlfriend to pursue her dream of being a photographer and we wouldn't have to endure the rest of this poor excuse of a sequel.

reviews.review_title: Watchable flick if viewed in isolation from its predecessor
reviews.content: Despite negative reviews all around, I actually enjoyed this one. It may not be as brilliant as the first instalment of the franchise, but the unpredictability of the plot kept me glued. I would rate the acting above average. The direction was well-oiled. You would definitely like it if you watch it in isolation from its predecessor. The movie kept its momentum till the end.Overall, a watchable flick if viewed in isolation from its predecessor.

reviews.review_title: I haven't seen this one yet, but...
reviews.content: I haven't seen this film yet. Primarily because I wasn't sure it was going to be worth bothering with since it has nothing to do worth the original and has a predictable stretch of a script. If I were to have written a sequel, pardon the follow-the-crowd, I would have made it a prequel. It simply makes more since. There are numerous possibilities. You could have gone with the crazy father from the first one who used photos he took to go back. Also, you could have used the other children who were still-borns which would suggest they did the same as he did in the Director's cut. As I said, lots of options. Why do screenwriters create a sequel that is a similar story without any solid link to the first? Just for the fun of it, why don't they do it anyway? Just make a couple of prequels with semi-known actors and a decent script, and then, maybe people will actually want to bother. Thanks.

With a movie that was released straight to DVD i had no high expectations and to tell the truth, I'm glad. This movie did not live up to the standards of the first movie, but they were able to present a semi-watchable sequel. This time around the story was basically the same with the main character trying to save the woman whom he loves and just messes up his and others lives repeatedly. The story was predictable and not horribly in-depth. The one slightly high point of the movie was Erica Durance. She is a beautiful woman and has talent (as shown in Smallville) although i think that this movie doesn't allow her to fully stretch out and show the full extent of her talents. (although she does show a greater part of her other asset's) All in all i think that this movie is worth the payment of the movie rental but i don't think that really you should pay the full price of the DVD.

reviews.review_title: Butterfly Effect II ?... Don't get your hopes up.. this is definitely not it
reviews.content: Let me just say that this is definitely not worthy of the title given to it for a all the reasons .First off the sound and image leave you with the impression that most of the movie is shot with a hand-held camera; don't get me wrong though that's not such a bad thing when used with some restraint like for example in Bourne Supremacy where it totally enhanced the experience, unlike here where it just felt low-budget. In regards to the screenplay, the only thing it has in common with the first part is the concept, no continuity no nothing. The dialogue is fairly simpletonish, but you can clearly see that the actors, well most of them, try their best to get the job done. In my opinion, the people in charge should have waited a little longer to get a bigger budget in order to get at least the screenwriter from part one, although both the screenwriter and the director from the Butterfly Effect would have at least ensured a sequel capable to stand up to its expectations. But we all know that money is expensive and it doesn't grow on trees so I guess we'll have to wait for part three maybe, who knows..Bottom line if you are going to see this movie anyway, expect it to give you the feeling that you've waisted 3-4 hours of your life when in fact the movie only lasted 10 minutes.Peace

Hey Everyone, I thought the movie was pretty bad but I the music was pretty killer. There wasn't a ton of bands but I did some digging. The scene right after the 2nd sex scene with (the "Thanks for coming" line) there is a shot of the main guy (Nick) driving in his car through the city and then parks it in a parking garage anyway the song they played during that was really killer, so I found out the song is from a band named Exit the Ordinary. If you look in the credits the song is named "The Place You Are". So I google them and found the site it's www.exittheordinary.com I thought I would let people know what good I could find in the movie & I thought the music scored a 10 and the movie a 3.5-4ish. Extra credit for making it in 25 days. Thanks

First of all I did not expect anything from this movie,i read the rewievs, i know 4.3 vote of film,and i though if it was a good movie,it must be on theaters..So if they make it directly to video,it must be because of,cheap acting and cheap scenario.. but i don't find acting very cheap,because of smallvile,i like Erica Durance,Eric Lively was good too,but he is not Ashton kutcher,but the film is same.. There were huge mistake i assume,When Evan is time-shifting he knows the past and the alternate time somehow transfered to him,but in butterfly effect 2,Nick doesn't even know which car he has.. The father's power to son ritual is same,which process better in first movie and the only good thing was reference of Jason Treborn,the father of Evan.. son if you watch first movie,watch this,it is like watching a very amateur copy of first movie with more sexual tension if you haven't watch first movie don't bother with this..it is directly to video for some reason..

I loved the first movie. I watched it over and over the first weekend I rented it. When I saw the second on the shelf I was so excited!!! What! No Ashton??? That's OK, how bad could it be???? WOW......That Bad!!!! I was bored to tears, waiting for something, anything that would justify the gas money it took to drive to to video store and rent this movie. But, sadly it never happened. I was let down by what could have been and should have been a great movie. Following some or one of the original characters from the first movie would have been great. But no, there were new characters already in their 20's that we were never told anything about. And the jumping here and there, I was left confused......just when I figured what the heck they were talking about.....boom..he's somewhere else. I finally stopped trying to figure it out half way through the movie because I realized I just didn't care!!!! In the first movie, I was on the edge of my seat to find out what was going to happen next. I was surprised by the clever plot and writing. The sequel had none of these things. I was on the edge of my seat alright, ready to shut the stupid thing off if it got any worse!!! I want my evening back!! (And my gas money) Maybe that can be the BE3. How to travel back in time and rent something else!!!

I never saw Butterfly Effect until yesterday which I saw it first before the second movie. I really liked the first one that I had to watch the second movie.But I was disappoint. I would never decide to shoot the movie if I read the manuscript. The story was so boring. Nothing that makes me want to stay whole movie, but I was very very patient.The worst of all, is the main actor. He doesn't seem to know how to act. He was so numb all of the time and didn't seem to feel anything else. Not even for his girlfriend.Whatever the budget they got to make the movie, is no excuse for that horrible boring movie. Personally I'm sure anywho good director could make far better movie with less budget. I wish Hollywood made more searching for good directors.

reviews.review_title: A poor series movie for "The Butterfly Effect 1"
reviews.content: I was totally disappointed after I watched this movie. This movie copy the same idea of the "The Butterfly Effect 1" but with a very poor story/script. The "The Butterfly Effect 1" really let me think something about time and space but this movie is just telling us a selfish man's crazy dream. The connection between each step of the the main character's "backward trip" are bad because he really don't have a good reason to change his past. I think the first trip he finished is the best since he save his girlfriend and other two friends form the car accident. However, he still want to change his past simply due to a unsuccessful working experience, this is unacceptable.

reviews.review_title: I wish it was possible to rate in negative stars
reviews.content: This movie misses on so many counts; here are just a few:Intelligence: my goldfish could have written a better movieActing: a display of the lack of talent in movies todaySuspense: the only suspense was would the viewer keep his or her eyes open or would the viewer fall asleepWorth the time: not even close, too bad I had to sit through this crap with someone who would not know a worthwhile movie if it bit her on the assWorth the money spent making the movie: no, if I were involved in the financial backing of this garbage, I would demand a refund in cash or in bloodRecommendation: bury this and the original in the deepest cesspool available as they both were POS.

reviews.review_title: How could they do this to my favorite movie ??
reviews.content: The Butterfly Effect was my favorite movie and when I heard a second one was coming out I was ecstatic !!! The fact that it was a straight to DVD movie meant that it wasn't going to be as good as the first, and I knew that. Never in my wildest dreams did I think they could make it that horrible.The first one, being my favorite movie, I decided to buy the second one before I rented it. I was so excited to see it that the moment I got home I put it in the DVD player and watched it.I don't even know what to say about it besides that it was AWFUL. It completely slaughtered the first one. Since I've seen the second one I cant even bring myself to watch the first one again.So not only did I waste 90 minutes of my life but also 15 dollars.

reviews.review_title: The acting in this movie was SOOOO BAD!
reviews.content: The acting in this movie was sooooo seriously bad! How do I go back in time to prevent this movie from every being made? It has nothing to do with the original. I've seen kids in high school plays act better than the cast of this movie. I wish I could go back in time and tell myself not to watch this movie because I wasted 90 minutes of my life on it.

This film is the reason why one should in general avoid sequels at all costs. The original wasn't all that great; this piece of "film-making" makes one wonder if anyone with a brain in their head was involved in the production. Terrible. Absolutely f...n terrible. A previous commentator lamented on this site that they didn't shoot enough film to make this movie a good one. I would argue that no amount of film could have saved this wretched thing. In fact, the producers should have saved all of film used on this time-waster to shoot anything except this movie ... anything except this movie (please).A horrid nonsensical mess that all involved should dis-associate themselves from if they value their careers, a film produced only to cash in on the questionable value of this "franchise".Let's hope its the last we hear from it. To be avoided like the pox.

I don't know why people find it too bad actually the first was not better than this one ..both are the same quality .. just movies you can waste a boring night watching them..no more no less neither the first wad genius nor the second

I did not understand what the producer was thinking....taking the idea from first movie and destroying it with this title. It could have made more sense if the screenwriter would have elaborate a meaningful dialogue between characters....but the actions are lacking logic, the mean character seems to adapt to the "new future" really fast but in the meantime pretends like he does not have an idea what is hapening...and why was it necesary from him to die?that could have been avoided easily....just don't go to your office on your girlfriend's birthday...and just don't be stupid when she tells you she is pregnat and act like "idc" but then you run after her like....what?....anyway, 1 star rating is waaay to much.

reviews.review_title: I wish I could give this a 0
reviews.content: This was so bad. Way too many needless sex scenes, the acting was the worst, plot was the same as the just as bad first one and the main character is an idiot through the entire film.

I wasted $12.00 on this stupid movie thinking that it was going to be just like the 1st movie but even better and boy was I wrong. For starters this movie is only 1 hr/10 min, the acting stinks, the plot was stupid and it barley had any excitement in it. Do not and I repeat do not waste your money on this piece of crap because you'll be as angry as I was, I have no idea what the writer/director was thinking and even though The Butterfly Effect 1 is old it's still worth buying and I just gotta say this 1 more time DO NOT buy The Butterfly Effect 2, wait for it to come on TV after u see it you'll be happy that you didn't waste your money.

Imagine that some series of mishaps grants you the ability to go back to a certain point in your life and change something that happened in hopes that the changes will positively affect the present. The Butterfly Effect did an excellent job in exploring this concept, and was a remarkable film. However, this sequel only makes you wish you had that ability so you could go back to the point in your life just before you paid to see it, and save your money.The problem is not so much the actors (though they were mediocre at best), it's the writers and directors that are responsible for this awful garbage. It's always irritating to see something that was once good have it's name tarnished by someone hoping to make a few bucks, and that is exactly the case here. The story was absurd. In the first movie, all of his doctors couldn't figure out the situation, but in this movie the guy nails it by doing a yahoo search on his lunch break? Honestly, I could write up a story about 2 gay astronauts stuck in a bathroom in the year 2060, and cast Jim Varney and Chris Tucker as the lead roles, and it would still be better than this.There is not one redeeming quality to this movie. It's a perfect example of Hollywood bigwigs taking the name of something that was once great and attaching it to something awful in hopes of squeezing out a few more dollars. All involved in the production of this movie should change careers now, rethink their lives, and hope God has mercy on their souls.Like others have said, save your money and your time.

Despite some negative reviews I have seen this movie a few times & always enjoy it.
The first movie was great & difficult to follow up but I think they succeeded.

The Butterfly effect 2 was totally pointless, this movie is just so stupid because the story has no meaning because it is totally boring. A guy Nick Larson (Eric Lively) finds out his girlfriend and his friends die in a car crash and he looks into a picture and goes into the past and all he does is gets revenge on his fellow workmates and tries to win back his girlfriend. The whole concept of changing the past, like in the first movie, was fascinating and the first movie was more entertaining, whilst this movie has degraded. The Whole concept of Time traveling and quantum Physics is very fascinating concept but the sequel made it all boring. Totally waste of my time watching the sequel. The first Butterfly effect is totally original, very real. This, however, was just Pointless. Bad acting, bad storyline, disgusting sex scenes,total waste of time, I will just pretend that there was one Butterfly Effect movie, not two.

reviews.review_title: Not as terrible as it seems
reviews.content: FYI: There are some mild spoilers.There are movies out there that are far more horrible than Butterfly Effect 2, and I feel this doesn't fall into that category.Sure it's not perfect, what falls flat with the sequel isn't the acting, or even the way the characters interacted with each other, it's the movie's inability to delve more into the powers as opposed to just dealing with the consequences of it (and it's likely due because we've seen what it is capable of in the original). The little research Nick did on alternate realities in association to migraines and finding a newspaper clipping of Evan's father's sickness was a good touch but like I said, I wished they had explored that angle further.Instead, they took the romance angle, which was fine but they could've done more. At the end, it gave me the distinct impression that Butterfly Effect 2 was a setup for something else. As if they needed to show this movie before really getting into something more.And Eric Lively is a capable actor, and Erica Durance did well with the material she's given. It ain't rocket science so I don't hold them to standards of the critical kind. I'm just glad that I wasn't rolling my eyes at their scenes much like when I did watching Cursed or Alone in the Dark.

reviews.review_title: Not sure why it's a sequel
reviews.content: Sure why it's a sequel because the story has no connection to the first one. They just copied some of the things from the first movie such as nosebleeds and memory loss. The time traveling didn't have the same purpose as the first and everything seemed haphazard. It was maybe entertaining but the plot wasn't profound or meaningful. And I really hate that every movie injects a vivid sex scene right in the middle so I have to rush to fast forward through inappropriate scenes.

reviews.review_title: Butterfly Effect 2 is a waste of film.
reviews.content: I sat down to watch this movie with high expectations; the first butterfly effect having been one of my favorite movies since it came out. I was sorely disappointed with what I saw. The Butterfly Effect 2 is an insult to the first of this sequel.When I wasn't being bombarded by overt sexual symbols, I was mentally noting the discrepancies in the plot relative to the first movie. The only thing worse than the writing and the directing was the acting.The plot was repetitive and yet somehow manages to be confusing. One can expect every motion of the film from beginning to end.Its only redeeming factor was the death of the protagonist, Nick.The cherry on the shitty cake was the opening for a trilogy at the end of the movie.

I thought part one, with Ashton Kutcher, was AWESOME. It had purpose and a meaningful story line of a kid who made a mistake that had consequences that he tried to right... you can see my review on it. This one on the other had, I saw as a little more one sided. A man who lost the love of his life went back to get her back. And then went for selfish reason to get a better position at work and more money to give his girlfriend the life she wanted...and then went back because his selfishness, which lost him his girl, cause her to get shot...and then went back....you get the picture. Needless to say, I didn't even finish it. Strated great, but the story line left a lot to be desired.

reviews.review_title: I actually enjoyed it! So there! 😋
reviews.content: I have watched a Tom of time travel movies and this was actually not among the worst. I really liked the crazy guy Luk? He made me stop and listen 2 or 3 times to stuff. Only part I didn't like was when he killed himself at the end. I didn't see the rationale...

"The Butterfly Effect" was superb. why? because the idea was original and I had no idea how the things would end in the film. Unfortunately nowadays, if a film is successful, it is highly possible that a remake of that film will appear. So here comes "The Butterfly Effect, 2".**Some minor spoilers about the film** We know the story, it is good but not plotted as well as the first film. The cast is not as good as the first one. But it wouldn't deserve 3 if it wasn't a remake. I gave 3 due to the lack of imagination and inspiration who got involved in this remake. Because of greed, they spoil good things. "Be original" motto is used in advertisements, how can they still skip it?There is no need to copy the ideas, because there is already one.... better.

The makers of this movie should die. The fact of the matter is i've longed for this film so bad, from 2005 when it was announced hoping it was somewhat like the first film. Of course you can't expect just as good but at least similar..I hate this so bad, not just the movie but the whole concept of -"Let's make a crappy sequel to a good movie so people will watch it and we'll get rich!"Im just waiting for "Friday the 13th: part 21" and "Nightmare on elm street 24" and heck, why not "Spiderman 7" while we're at it.Series should know when to end as well.

reviews.review_title: have a love affair with the teen market
reviews.content: Let's give a big smack on the lips to the smart folks that didn't try to fix what wasn't broken. The set-up smashes you upside the head with a rubber mallet. The dialogue is choked out by a cast that seems to have run out of steam. The movie wasn't a sequel but a re-attempt of the original. We got it the first time and still came back. The only difference with #2 is new faces, hair-cuts and no originality. But, it still works. This is not "The Deer Hunter" or "A Beautiful Life," by a long shot. The sequel is a smart and most likely successful attempt to capitalize on the vague memory of the first. This product is coming out just late enough for the audience to have forgiven the original and soon enough to remember the title.

reviews.review_title: A disturbing piece of cow s***
reviews.content: Im enraged I can't vote lower than one for this piece of S***! I was so happy that a sequel was coming out to a pretty good movie, the butterfly effect. I popped it my DVD player. Started watching. The plot was terrible, nothing made sense, pornography was half the movie....then there came this one scene. I almost gagged. The main character had woken up on a bed to find a male giving him a blow job. Great. What a piece of s***. I stopped watching after that. This is not a good movie. DO NOT WATCH IT. I wasted my time on this, do not waste yours. To make it even worse than this--- the characters are all shallow, not one tense moment, not one GOOD moment. Such a low budget piece of crap.... No good effects or nothing. I can't believe I paid a dollar for renting it.

reviews.review_title: Here is Why I Think This Movie is Stupid!
reviews.content: I have just watched this movie & found it really Really Stupid!!!!!! I don't know what the heck was wrong with the first life he teleported into!! Just because his wife layed some very light insults on him he teleported into other place.To be honest with ya this movie was going good until the middle,and then fell off a 1000 stores into 10 miles hole wide underground.Its more of a love story then there is anything to do with the real Butterfly Effect + he seems to have tasted a horrible Nightmare & pain in his first life,how can he pass on all that for some stupid business he was convinced on leaving? I would add something the end was very very predictable that it made me sick to my stomach totally ignoring the fact that that his child may posses any powers!

reviews.review_title: If you haven't seen either movies, see this one first!...
reviews.content: If this were not a sequel to such a great movie (I wouldn't have touched it)... It would probably be alright for light entertainment. I mean 'Hey, I've seen worse movies!' But having seen and loved the original Butterfly effect I felt cheated by this 70 - 80 minute long superficial, boring and confusing movie.The protagonists actions lack the urgency of the original as the problems faced are far more trivial and selfish. The ensuing parallel plots seem to be less effected by human nature and more effected by the roll of the dice with out any explanation. The ending should have been a good two more alternate realities away by my opinion.Also choosing death over leaving his job? I'd have given this movie at least one more star, even if this would make it 5 minutes shorter and cheesy as hell if ...'He's out on the rocks with the girlie, she tells him she's having a baby, he says wow that's great! His phone rings, he pulls it out has a look and then throws it into the abyss and says honey let's move to New York!... A crappy Hollywood ending I know, but at least it makes sense!Also the poorly thought out time travel through pictures concept raised an issue with me and had me thinking last night about the illogical ending of the original movie. What sense does it make that just before the end he was able to use pictures taken by.. any one to go back?Disappointing - watch before the original or not at all!

reviews.review_title: not great but not as bad as people think
reviews.content: it's not fantastic. nowhere near as good as the first one and may have fared better as a standalone movie (it was removed enough from the original to avoid any legal complications in my opinion) as compared to it's amazing predecessor. However there were some nice touches in it and Erica Durances performance was brilliant. My main gripe with it is that it didn't involve us in the characters life enough. In the original we were shown how the main characters life was before he changed it for the first half hour or so and could relate to his feelings. We were given no history into this character whatsoever and the amount of time he spent changing his life meant we could never really get used to him as he was constantly changing his memories. It was a very nice touch at the end showing the baby had inherited his fathers abilities and the gift/curse was passing through the bloodline. Hopefully not an excuse for a trilogy i don't think i could stomach it.
